refresher.title: üßí React Explained Like a Child
refresher.content:
# üß† Simple Question First

**What is React?**

üëâ React helps the screen **update automatically** when data changes.

That‚Äôs it. Nothing more.

---

## üß± Life Before React (The Problem)

Imagine you write a number on a board:

> Count: 0

Now every time the number changes:
- You erase it
- You write a new number

You must remember **where** to erase and **where** to write.

This is how websites worked before React.

---

## üòñ Why This Was Painful

- Developers manually changed the screen
- Missed some places
- UI broke easily
- Bugs appeared everywhere

Developers were **afraid to touch working code**.

history.title: üìú How React Was Born
history.content:
# üè¢ Facebook‚Äôs Big Problem

Facebook had:
- Likes
- Comments
- Messages
- Notifications

When one thing changed, many parts of the screen needed updates.

Manual control failed.

---

## üí° The Smart Idea

Facebook engineers said:

> "Don‚Äôt touch the screen directly."

> "Just change the data."

> "We‚Äôll update the screen for you."

React was created internally around **2011** and shared publicly in **2013**.

why.title: ü§î Why We Use React
why.content:
## ‚úÖ React‚Äôs Promise

- You change **data**
- React changes **UI**

You stop worrying about the screen.

---

## üß† One Golden Rule

```text
Data ‚Üí UI
```

If data is correct,
UI is always correct.

This gives developers **confidence and courage**.
